data.title: www.guru3d.com
data.meta_description: Guru3D.com - Your go-to source for tech news, reviews, and in-depth analysis of graphics cards, processors, motherboards, gaming hardware, and software from companies like AMD (Radeon) Intel (Core) and NVIDIA (GeForce). Stay updated with the latest trends and innovations in the world of technology .
data.text:
{2024-07-24}

AMD ZEN5 - A Deeper Dive Into Architecture

AMD has announced the release of its Ryzen 9000 desktop CPU series, scheduled for July 2024. This next-generation series, based on the Zen5 architecture, includes the Ryzen 9 9950X, Ryzen 9 9900X, Ryzen 7 7900X, and Ryzen 5 9600X, all part of the "Granite Ridge" lineup. The Zen5 architecture represents the fifth generation of AMD's Zen series CPU microarchitectures, demonstrating the company's ongoing innovation in the processor market. The new Zen5 microarchitecture will power the AMD Ryzen 9000 series "Granite Ridge" processors for desktops, the Ryzen AI 300 series "Strix Point" processors for notebooks, and the 5th Gen EPYC "Turin" server processors. We dive into the ZEN5 architecture.

AIDA64 Download Version 7.35

Download AIDA64 - AIDA64 Extreme is an efficient diagnostic and benchmarking tool designed for Windows users at home. This software offers several functionalities to help with overclocking, identifying hardware issues, conducting stress tests, and monitoring sensors. It can precisely evaluate the performance of processors, system memory, disk drives, and GPUs that support OpenCL. AIDA64 Extreme is fully compatible with all modern 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Microsoft Windows, including Windows 11.

Zen 5 Review In italy: Comparative Performance of Ryzen 9 9900X vs Ryzen 7 7800X3D in Gaming

Italian tech reviewer SaddyTech has provided an review of AMD’s upcoming Ryzen 9 9900X processor, ahead of its official release. The review offers a comparative analysis of the Ryzen 9 9900X and the Ryzen 7 7800X3D, focusing primarily on their gaming performance. The Ryzen 9 9900X is a 12-core CPU with a boost clock speed of up to 5.6 GHz, a TDP of 120W, and an expected market price of approximately $550 to $600. SaddyTech’s sample is a retail unit, confirmed by its recent manufacturing date and 2424 laser engraving. The test setup included a GeForce RTX 4090 graphics card, an X670 motherboard, DDR5-7200 memory, and a Be Quiet Dark Rock 4 air cooler.

» Read full story

ModelFarm Will be Moving to AMD Ryzen 9 9950X Due to Intel Chip Failures

Dylan Browne, Unreal Engine Supervisor and Feature Film VFX expert at ModelFarm visual effects studio, has reported a significant issue with Intel's Core i9-13900K and 14900K processors. According to Browne, ModelFarm is experiencing a 50% failure rate with these Intel-powered systems. As a response, the company is transitioning to AMD's upcoming Zen 5 Ryzen 9 9950X processors, highlighting AMD's excellent single-thread performance.

» Read full story

Intel Core Ultra 9 285K Arrow Lake ES Details Pop Up in CPU-Z Screenshot

An image has appeared on social media showing a CPU-Z screenshot of what seems to be a new Intel Core Ultra 9 285K processor, which is part of the Arrow Lake-S series. This image, shared by a user named wxnod, shows a processor identified with a deep blue badge typical of the Core Ultra 9 series. The screenshot indicates that this processor, the Core Ultra 9 285K, has a base power of 125 watts, which usually denotes a high-performance model. This new chip is designed for the upcoming Intel Socket LGA1851. The manufacturing process used is 7 nm, matching Intel's 4 foundry node. Intel uses this technology for both the Arrow Lake-S and the compute tile of its "Meteor Lake" processor.

» Read full story

Micron Unveils 9550 NVMe Data Center SSD

Micron Technology, Inc. has announced the release of the Micron 9550 NVMe SSD, a high-performance data center storage solution designed to meet the demands of AI workloads. This new SSD integrates Micron's own controller, NAND, DRAM, and firmware, providing optimized performance, power efficiency, and advanced security features for data center operators. The Micron 9550 SSD offers exceptional performance with sequential read speeds of 14.0 GB/s and sequential write speeds of 10.0 GB/s. This results in a 67% improvement over similar SSDs in the market. Additionally, the SSD achieves random read speeds of 3,300 KIOPS and random write speeds of 400 KIOPS, outperforming competitors by 35% and 33%, respectively. These capabilities make the 9550 SSD ideal for demanding workloads, including AI applications.

» Read full story

Rumor: Nvidia TITAN AI Graphics Card: 512-bit memory bus, 63% Faster Than RTX 4090

RedGamingTech has unveiled in a recent video that NVIDIA is in the process of developing a new graphics card named TITAN AI. This forthcoming GPU is anticipated to deliver performance that is 63% superior to NVIDIA's GeForce RTX 4090 and 10% faster than the upcoming RTX 5090. The TITAN AI is expected to feature a 512-bit memory bus and up to 32GB of GDDR7 video memory. In comparison, the GeForce RTX 5090 is reported to have a 448-bit memory bus and 28GB of GDDR7 video memory.

» Read full story

ASUS Introduces Server and Workstation Products with AMD EPYC 4004 Processors

ASUS has unveiled a range of server and workstation products featuring the AMD EPYC 4004 series processors. These products are designed to meet the needs of data centers (IDC) and small to medium-sized enterprises, delivering advanced performance and capabilities. The AMD EPYC 4004 series, part of the AM5 platform and utilizing Zen 4 architecture, was launched in May. These processors offer configurations with up to 16 cores and incorporate 3D V-Cache technology, aimed at enhancing computational efficiency and performance.

» Read full story

D-Link Releases G530 5G NR AX3000 Wi-Fi 6 Router

D-Link Corporation has announced the release of the G530 5G NR AX3000 Wi-Fi 6 router, designed to utilize 5G technology by connecting with a mobile carrier's SIM card to deliver high-speed internet through a Wi-Fi 6 network. This router aims to provide a fast, reliable, and flexible networking solution for homes, offices, remote locations, and temporary setups where traditional wired connections are not feasible.

» Read full story

ReShade download v6.2.0

Here you can download ReShade, this application is an advanced, fully generic post-processing injector for games and video software developed by crosire. Imagine your favorite game with ambient occlusion, real depth of field effects, color correction and more.

Sabrent Releases DS-T4WA Display Arm with Thunderbolt 4 Docking Station

Sabrent, based in the USA, has introduced the DS-T4WA, a display arm that integrates a docking station with Thunderbolt 4 connectivity. This innovative product aims to enhance workstation setups by combining multiple functionalities into a single, streamlined unit. The DS-T4WA's base features a comprehensive array of interfaces, including two Thunderbolt 4 ports, one DisplayPort 1.4, one HDMI 2.1, one Gigabit LAN port, a 3.5mm audio jack, an SD/microSD card reader, one USB Type-A (5Gbps/5W PD compatible), one USB Type-A (10Gbps/7.5W PD compatible), and two USB Type-C ports (10Gbps/15W PD compatible). These ports facilitate the connection of up to three displays, providing a versatile solution for multi-monitor setups.

» Read full story

Intel (again) Addresses Stability Issues in 13th and 14th Gen Processors with Microcode Update

Intel identifies excessive voltage as a main cause. Intel's 13th and 14th Gen desktop processors have been experiencing stability issues, which have been widely discussed online. In response to these concerns, Intel announced on their official forum on July 23rd that they plan to release a microcode update in mid-August to address these problems. Intel's internal analysis of returned 13th and 14th Gen processors identified that the instability was due to elevated operating voltages caused by incorrect microcode algorithms. To address this, Intel will provide microcode updates aimed at correcting these voltage issues.

» Read full story

AMD Strix Halo Processor Benchmarks Surface, registers 5.36 GHz boost clock

AMD's upcoming Strix Halo mobile processor, featuring up to 16 "Zen 5" CPU cores and a powerful integrated GPU with 40 compute units, is beginning to appear in online benchmark databases. The launch of the Strix Point series, also known as Ryzen AI 300, is imminent, but the focus is now shifting towards the more advanced Halo series. While both processors share names and underlying microarchitectures, they differ significantly in design. The Halo series targets the high-end APU segment, currently dominated by Apple's M-series products. AMD aims to offer a range of high-performance APUs with the Strix Halo leading the charge.

» Read full story

YMTC Initiates Patent Lawsuit Against Micron Over 3D NAND Technology

Chinese memory manufacturer Yangtze Memory Technologies Co., Ltd. (YMTC) has initiated legal action against U.S.-based Micron Technology, Inc. in a California court. The lawsuit alleges that Micron has infringed upon 11 of YMTC's patents related to 3D NAND Flash and DRAM technologies. YMTC is seeking an injunction to stop Micron from selling the contested products in the U.S. market and is also demanding royalty payments for the alleged infringement. YMTC, founded in Wuhan, China, in 2016, plays a significant role in China's strategic initiative to establish a self-sufficient semiconductor industry. In October 2022, the U.S. government added YMTC to its Entity List, thereby limiting its access to advanced American manufacturing equipment necessary for producing 128-layer or more 3D NAND chips.

» Read full story

NVIDIA GeForce RTX 50-Series Blackwell to Launch in January 2025 at CES

NVIDIA is expected to introduce its GeForce RTX 50-series graphics cards during the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) 2025. This information was disclosed by prominent NVIDIA leaker @kopite7kimi on social media. The CES trade show is scheduled to take place from January 7 to 10, 2025. According to @kopite7kimi, the RTX 50-series will not be seen until CES 2025. Earlier this year, the leaker had hinted at a possible announcement by the end of 2024. However, other sources also indicated a release during the last quarter of 2024. This suggests that 2024 may be the second consecutive year without a new GPU generation launch from either NVIDIA or AMD.

» Read full story

AMD President Victor Peng to Retire

AMD today announced that AMD President Victor Peng is retiring effective August 30, 2024. He will continue to serve on the AMD executive team in an advisory role and support the transition until his retirement date. "Victor re-joined AMD in 2022 following the acquisition of Xilinx and played an important role successfully integrating and scaling our embedded business and leading our cross-company AI strategy," said AMD Chair and CEO Dr. Lisa Su. "Under his leadership, AMD became the industry's #1 provider of FPGA and adaptive computing solutions. On behalf of the AMD Board, executive leadership team and the thousands of employees who have worked with him, I want to thank Victor for his outstanding leadership and wish him the best in his retirement."

» Read full story

ASUS Announces All-New Server-Grade Hardware Powered by AMD EPYC 4004

ASUS today announced an all-new range of servers, workstations and motherboards driven by the power of AMD EPYC 4004 CPUs - heralding next-level performance and density. The new offerings include: ASUS Pro ER100A B6, a compact, 1U rack server. ASUS ExpertCenter Pro ET500A B6, a power-efficient Zen 4 workstation, ASUS Pro WS 665-ACE, a resilient ATX workstation motherboard; and ASUS Pro WS 600M-CL, a compact, chipset-less mATX motherboard for workstation applications.

» Read full story

ASRock Launches New PG27FFT1A and PG27FFT1B 180 Hz Gaming Monitors

ASRock, the global leading manufacturer of motherboards, graphics cards, mini PCs, and gaming monitors, today launched the second wave of its 180 Hz gaming monitor series, signaling that 180 Hz refresh rate is just the beginning, not the end. The new models, PG27FFT1A and PG27FFT1B, feature 27-inch screens with FHD resolution, combining the power of 180 Hz high refresh rate with Fast IPS panel technology to create an unparalleled visual feast of extreme smoothness and vibrant colors.

» Read full story

Ryzen 9000 Series Pricing Listed in the Netherlands - Ryzen 9 9900X for 508 euro

The pricing for AMD Ryzen 9000 processors in the Netherlands has been disclosed. According to a listing on Amazon.nl, the Ryzen 9 9900X is priced at approximately 508E/$549, the Ryzen 7 9700X at about E406/$449, and the Ryzen 5 9600X at around E319/$349. Mind you that these prices are based on 21% VAT, which differs per EU country. But overall this seems to be a proper indication.

» Read full story

Stability Issues in 13th and 14th Gen Intel CPUs Also Spotted With Laptops

Lots of reports have highlighted instability issues in 13th and 14th Gen Intel CPUs, not only in PCs but also extending to servers and laptops using these processors. A developer from Alderon Games shared on Reddit that the studio is experiencing problems with mobile devices equipped with the latest Intel CPUs. This extends the concern beyond the previously thought problem with the LGA-1700 SoC, suggesting a more intricate issue. The developer noted in follow-up comments that nearly 100% of their Raptor Lake processors were failing. The exact models of CPUs experiencing these issues in Alderon Games' laptops were not specified, but it is believed that the instability predominantly affects Intel Core i9 HX chips. Despite efforts, Intel has yet to provide a clear explanation or solution to the problem.

» Read full story

FTC Criticizes Microsoft Game Pass Price Increases and Strategy Post-Activision Blizzard Merger

The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has expressed strong concerns regarding Microsoft's recent changes to its Game Pass pricing and strategy. This scrutiny follows Microsoft's acquisition of Activision Blizzard, raising questions about the company's commitments and the potential impact on consumers. The FTC previously highlighted potential consumer harm resulting from Microsoft's acquisition of Activision Blizzard. According to the FTC, "The product degradation, such as the removal of the most valuable games from Microsoft's new service, combined with price increases for existing users, exemplifies the type of consumer harm anticipated from the merger."

» Read full story

Microsoft Releases CrowdStrike Recovery Tool to Address BSOD Issue

Microsoft has introduced an official Recovery Tool to assist developers and system administrators in recovering computers affected by the recent CrowdStrike update. This update led to widespread Blue Screen of Death (BSOD) issues, impacting approximately 8.5 million Windows devices. While a manual solution exists, it is time-consuming and requires specific authorization, posing a significant challenge for organizations dealing with hundreds or thousands of affected machines. The problematic CrowdStrike update was installed remotely via an automatic update, causing extensive IT disruptions last Thursday. However, the resolution requires manual intervention on each affected machine, resulting in thousands of IT personnel working extended hours to mitigate the issue.

» Read full story

Nvidia Business Model at Risk if AI Investments Fail, Warns SK Group Boss

Chey Tae-won, Chairman of the Korean Chamber of Commerce and Industry (KCCI) and SK Group, expressed concerns at the 47th KCCI Jeju Forum that Nvidia's business model could face significant challenges if AI investments do not yield profitable returns. Chey emphasized that if competitors such as AMD and Arm offer high-quality chips at lower prices, Nvidia's dominance in the market could be jeopardized.

» Read full story

Rumor: New AMD RDNA 4 Architecture Ray Tracing Hardware Features Revealed

new leaks have provided insight into AMD's upcoming RDNA 4 graphics architecture, which is set to introduce significant enhancements in ray tracing performance. Since May, it has been known that AMD aims to improve ray tracing by integrating more of the ray tracing workflow into dedicated, fixed-function hardware, thereby reducing the load on the shader engine. A reliable source, Kepler_L2, has disclosed several new hardware features that AMD will incorporate into RDNA 4 to better accelerate ray tracing and lower the performance cost associated with enabling this feature. These improvements are also expected to be part of the GPU in the upcoming Sony PlayStation 5 Pro.

» Read full story

Intel Introduces 14th Gen Core E Embedded Processors with Disabled E-cores

Intel has launched a new series of 14th Gen Core "Raptor Lake Refresh" Socket LGA1700 processors tailored for the embedded systems market. These processors, distinguished by the absence of "Gracemont" E-core clusters, consist exclusively of P-cores. Interestingly, Intel is not producing these chips in the non-socketed BGA packages typically associated with its mobile platforms. These processors address nearly all performance market segments, including high-end applications.

» Read full story
